pullRequest.title: Unsigned long HexSequence for name of PgPreparedStatement

commit.message:
Merge branch 'master' into HexSequence-PgPreparedStatement

Signed-off-by: Julian Ladisch <eclipse.org-rtn@ladisch.de>

Increment a long as counter

Signed-off-by: Julian Ladisch <eclipse.org-rtn@ladisch.de>

nodes.bodyText: this should avoid using an intermediary string. Instead it should allocate the byte[] with the right length and poke the corresponding value in it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) 2020 Contributors to the Eclipse Foundation + * + * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under the + * terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which is available at + * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0, or the Apache License, Version 2.0 + * which is available at https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0. + * + * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 + */ + +package io.vertx.sqlclient.impl; + +import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets; +import java.util.Locale; + +/** + * A sequence of hex values, each terminated by a zero byte. + * + * The hex number is left padded to start with at least three 0 + * and to have at least seven digits. + * + * After 000FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF it will restart with 0000000. + * + * The generated sequence: + * 
+ * 0000000
+ * 0000001
+ * 0000002
+ * ...
+ * 000FFFF
+ * 00010000
+ * ...
+ * 000FFFFF
+ * 000100000
+ * ...
+ * 000FFFFFF
+ * 0001000000
+ * ...
+ * 000FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF
+ *
+ */ +public class HexSequence { + private long i; + + /** + * Start the sequence with 0000000. + */ + public HexSequence() { + i = 0; + } + + /** + * @param startValue unsigned long for the first value returned by {@link #next()} + */ + public HexSequence(long startValue) { + i = startValue; + } + + /** + * @return a copy of the next hex value, terminated by a zero byte. + */ + public byte[] next() { + String hex = Long.toUnsignedString(i, 16).toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT); + i++; + switch (hex.length()) { + case 1: return ("000000" + hex + "\0").getBytes(StandardCharsets.US_ASCII);

nodes.bodyText: we should use a constant for this
@franz1981 do you mind having a look ?

The hex number is left padded to start with at least three 0 + * and to have at least seven digits. + * + *

After 000FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF it will restart with 0000000. + * + *

The generated sequence: + *

+ * ...

+ * 0001000000

commit.message:
Use EMPTY_STRING constant

Signed-off-by: Julian Ladisch <julianladisch@users.noreply.github.com>

Delete unused StringLongSequence

Signed-off-by: Julian Ladisch <julianladisch@users.noreply.github.com>

Move i++ into separate line for readability

Signed-off-by: Julian Ladisch <julianladisch@users.noreply.github.com>
